generif.text: Nore1 is a member of a family of Ras effector/tumor suppressors that includes RASSF1

the epigenetic alteration of NORE1A is confined to lung tumors with a wild-type K-ras: 88% (15 of 17) of the tumors with NORE1 hypermethylation did not harbor a K-ras mutation (P=0.008, Fisher's exact test)
Rap1 activation contributes to directional vascular endothelial cell migration accompanied by extension of microtubules on which RAPL localizes
results indicate that RASSF1A epigenetic changes are an early event in thyroid tumor pathogenesis and progression
Suppression of NORE1A, a known Ras effector, in PAX8-PPARgamma fusion-carrying follicular thyroid cancer.
association of NORE1A with cytoskeletal elements is essential for NORE1A-induced growth suppression and that the ERK pathway is a target for NORE1A growth-suppressive activities
The candidate tumor suppressor gene NORE1B is epigenetically down-regulated in hepatocellular carcinoma.
These findings suggest that endogenous Nore1B recruits active Ras to the APC-T cell interface and mediates the interaction between Ras and Carma1.
The NORE1A gene was never found epigenetically methylated in hepatitic or non-hepatitic liver.
Nuclear localization of RASSF5 is critical for its cell growth control activity.

interaction surfaces in RAPL-Rap1 and RAPL-Rap2 complexes are different and that a single residue in the switch I region of Rap proteins (residue 39) contributes considerably to the different kinetics of these protein-protein interactions.
nuclear export of NORE1A via nuclear export signal is involved in the NORE1A-mediated induction of apoptosis

NORE1A promoter methylation is a rare event in neuroblastoma cells and primary tumors. Other mechanisms are likely to account for the frequent reduction of NORE1A mRNA expression. Also, antitumorigenic role of NORE1A in human neuroblastoma is evident.

Study describes the crystal structure of Ras in complex with the Ras binding domain (RBD) of NORE1A; the contact area of NORE1A is extended as compared with other Ras effectors & provides a rationale for an exceptionally long lifetime of the complex.
findings showed that only 4% of the glioma tumors revealed a methylated promoter for NORE1A
Data show that degradation by calpains is a novel mechanism for downregulation of NORE1A and RASSF1A proteins and might be the mechanism allowing cancer cells to escape growth suppression.

NORE1B suppresses replication and transformation of cells as effectively as RASSF1A and is a putative tumor suppressor gene. NORE1B interacts with RASSF1A and loss of one of these may lead to uncontrolled growth and transformation of hepatocytes.
NORE1A activates p21(CIP1) via promoting p53 nuclear localization.
The present investigation provided evidence that Lck-mediated phosphorylation regulates the nucleocytoplasmic shuttling and cell growth control activities of RASSF5.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
a novel regulatory network composed of the tumor suppressor NORE1A, the mitotic kinase Aurora A, the small GTPase Ras, and the microtubule cytoskeleton.
findings define a T cell receptor "inside-out" pathway via N-SKAP1-C-RapL that regulates T cell adhesion, motility, and arrest times with dendritic cells in lymph nodes.
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)

NORE1A has activity that suppresses the centrosome amplification induced by HU and that NORE1A mRNA down-regulation is one of the common gene abnormalities in NSCLCs, both of which imply a key preventive role of NORE1A against the carcinogenesis of NSCLC.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
epigenetic inactivation of NORE1 due to aberrant promoter hypermethylation is a frequent event in colorectal tumorigenesis and might be implicated in the malignant progression of colorectal tumors
N-terminal myr-tagged SKAP1 for membrane binding facilitated constitutive RapL membrane and Rap1 binding and effectively substituted for PI3K and TCR ligation in the activation of LFA-1 in T cells.

These findings indicate that the control of HIPK1 stability by Mdm2-NORE1 has a major effect on cell behaviour, and epigenetic inactivation of NORE1 enables adenocarcinoma formation in vivo through HIPK1 stabilization.
The RASSF gene family members RASSF5, RASSF6 and RASSF7 show frequent DNA methylation in neuroblastoma.
crystal of NORE1 diffracted to 2.7 A resolution and belonged to space group P6(1)22, with unit-cell parameters a = b = 73.041, c = 66.092 A, alpha = beta = 90, gamma = 120 degrees
Ubiquitin ligase Itch is a unique negative regulator of RASSF5.
RASSF5 can act as an inhibitor or a potential positive regulator of Mst2, depending on whether it binds to Mst2 before or after activation-loop phosphorylation.
RASSF5 expression is negatively correlated with distant metastasis of osteosarcoma, and RASSF5 may function as a tumor suppressor in OS cells through activation of the MST1/LATS1 pathway.
NORE1A has a role in Ras regulation of SCF(beta-TrCP) protein activity and specificity
Down-regulation of RASSF5A and RASSF5C expression is a tumor-specific phenomenon.

the inactivation of RASSF5A through CpG island 1 methylation may play an important role in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) carcinogenesis, RASSF5A may be a functional tumor suppressor and may serve as a prognostic biomarker for ESCC.
NORE1A allows Ras to qualitatively modify p53 function to promote senescence.
Ras induces the formation of a complex between NORE1A and the phosphatase PP1A, promoting the activation of the Rb tumor suppressor by dephosphorylation

mCD40L-induced cell death mediated by NORE1A expression appeared to be independent of mCD40L-induced cell death mediated by sustained JNK activation since NORE1A inhibition did not affect JNK phosphorylation and vice versa
Hepatitis C virus uses NS5B to specifically suppress NORE1A, facilitating viral replication and elevated Ras signaling.
Our study demonstrated that miR-214 expression was elevated and RASSF5 was down regulated in oral cancer. Moreover, miR-214 suppressed KB cell apoptosis through down regulation of RASSF5 expression
REVIEW: elucidate the acknowledged structure, progress in the verified functions and research advances of RASSF5 and the probably relevant signaling pathways
Ubc9 is an essential regulator of ADAP where it is required for TCR-induced membrane recruitment of the small GTPase Rap1 and its effector protein RapL.
NORE1A directs apoptotic switch of TNF signaling through reciprocal modulation of ITCH-mediated destruction of TNFRI and BAX.
Engineered variants of the Ras effector protein RASSF5 (NORE1A) promote anticancer activities in lung adenocarcinoma.
The Rejuvenation and Functional Restoration of Aged Adipose Stem Cells by DUXAP10 Knockdown via the Regulation of the miR-214-3p/RASSF5 Axis.

interpro.desc: Ras association domain-containing protein 5, RA domain
Protein kinase C-like, phorbol ester/diacylglycerol-binding domain

name: Ras association domain family member 5
other_names: regulator for cell adhesion and polarization enriched in lymphoid tissue

kegg.name: Non-small cell lung cancer - Homo sapiens (human)

pid.name: TCR signaling in naïve CD8+ T cells
TCR signaling in naïve CD4+ T cells

wikipathways.name: Overview of leukocyte-intrinsic Hippo pathway functions

summary: This gene is a member of the Ras association domain family. It functions as a tumor suppressor, and is inactivated in a variety of cancers. The encoded protein localizes to centrosomes and microtubules, and associates with the GTP-activated forms of Ras, Rap1, and several other Ras-like small GTPases. The protein regulates lymphocyte adhesion and suppresses cell growth in response to activated Rap1 or Ras. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
